         The NYUAD Art Gallery                                                                                                                            Breadcrumbs                                  Home                                               News & Events                                               Abu Dhabi Events                                               Reversible: Narrating Identity from the Inside Out and Outside In                                                          Reversible: Narrating Identity from the Inside Out and Outside In                                                              Conference      Reversible: Narrating Identity from the Inside Out and Outside In                  By Invitation Only                                    Date                   December 7-9, 2014                                                                    Location           Abu Dhabi                                                                            In a globalized and interconnected world, how do artists navigate the increasingly fluid concepts of country, home, and identity? This convening brings together contemporary artists from the MENASA region and beyond to reflect on their methodologies and intersecting themes, including: The Artist and Society; Artist as Researcher; Navigating Private and Public Spaces; Notes from the Field: Our Interconnected World; and Memory: Using and Creating Personal and Official Archives. Performances, works-in-progress, and lively discussion comprise this three-day convening. The December 8 sessions are hosted at the Sharjah Art Foundation .     More information at: www.findreversible.com                                                                       Convened by                              Mo Ogrodnik Associate Professor of Film and New Media and Principle Investigator, FIND, NYUAD; Associate Professor, Kanbar Institute of Film ,          NYU Tisch School of the Arts                                          In Collaboration with                                                                                                                                        Modern Architecture in Abu Dhabi, 1968-1992               This panel discussion explores the little known modernist heritage of Abu Dhabi and addresses the complex issue of architectural preservation. We discuss how the city radically transformed over four decades, what modern influences resonate within its landscape, and which events and people helped shape our built environment.
